definition: adornment/to adorn/dress/clothing/costume (of an actor in a play)/to play a role/to pretend/to install/to fix/to wrap (sth in a bag)/to load/to pack
decoration/ornament/to decorate/to adorn/to hide/to conceal (a fault)/excuse (to hide a fault)/to play a role (in opera)/to impersonate
article/commodity/product/goods/kind/grade/rank/character/disposition/nature/temperament/variety/to taste sth/to sample/to criticize/to comment/to judge/to size up/fret (on a guitar or lute)

sentences.english: Those are only our decoration, coz we never follow the money.
sentences.chinese: 那只是偶們的裝飾品，偶們從來不會被錢奴役。

sentences.english: They’ll make the invitations, hang the decorations, and even serve the food.
sentences.chinese: 他們將會發邀請函，佈置裝飾品，和甚至提供食物。

sentences.english: It is the perfection and the supreme adornment of the justified soul.
sentences.chinese: 這是完善和最高人民法院裝飾品的理由靈魂。

sentences.english: He buy her trinket and take her to the theater.
sentences.chinese: 他給她購買小裝飾品並帶她去看戲。

sentences.english: So it is both a kind of artistical work and a practical everyday life decoration accessories.
sentences.chinese: 它既是藝術品，又是生活中的實用裝飾品。

sentences.english: The ornamentation Vincent used to decorate his house at Christmas was very tasteful.
sentences.chinese: 聖誕節期間，文森特家裏使用的裝飾品非常有品味。

sentences.english: At first, he and his team weren’t looking for Christmas ornaments.
sentences.chinese: 一開始，他和他的團隊並沒有想到調查聖誕裝飾品。

sentences.english: When adorned with national Turkmenian silver decorations, gray horses look stunning.
sentences.chinese: 當裝飾品裝飾與國家土庫曼斯坦銀，灰馬，令人炫目。

sentences.english: The rubbings also make an attractive decoration for the front of a holiday greeting card.
sentences.chinese: 拓片也是節日賀卡正面引人注目的裝飾品。

sentences.english: The holiday decorations also feature a 6-meter Christmas tree on the building's 94th floor.
sentences.chinese: 在大樓的94層還以6米高的聖誕樹作爲節日裝飾品。

sentences.english: I buy Scooby-Doo decorations for Wes's birthday cake three months before his birthday.
sentences.chinese: 我提前三個月給維斯的生日蛋糕買了史酷比的裝飾品。

sentences.english: Enough wedding china to serve two dozen people.
sentences.chinese: 足夠兩打人使用的婚禮裝飾品。

sentences.english: The old hand-held storm lantern has become a decoration which reminds one of old times.
sentences.chinese: 老式玻璃風燈，如今成了懷舊的裝飾品。

sentences.english: We took about 800 ornaments left over from previous administration.
sentences.chinese: 前任政府留下了800多件裝飾品。

sentences.english: The mental patient thinks the cement is the elementary element of the ornament.
sentences.chinese: 精神病人認爲水泥是裝飾品的基本成分分。

sentences.english: The table top was so highly polished that it mirrored the ornaments placed on it .
sentences.chinese: 桌面擦得錚亮，把放在上面的裝飾品都映出來了。

definition: to arrange/to set out/to decorate/to display/decorative items
